moves.10. Bxb5+: It is against the law to answer with Bxb4+ (recalling a scholastic tourney I directed, in which I asked a player why he didn't put his opponent in checkmate, and he responded, "I was thinking about it, but then he's just gonna put me in checkmate."
moves.11. fxe5: bringing another flank pawn to the center so now I have 3 vs 1 in central files
moves.11... Bxb4+: now the check comes but it is too late, I already have too many tempo gains
moves.12. Kf1: instead of f2 I think I am safer here
moves.12... fxe4: now it's 2 vs 2 in the center but I am to move
moves.13. Qxd4: now it is 2 vs 1 and I threaten to win with e6
moves.15. Qxh8: I take the rook for free
moves.16. Bh6+: but I win with Ke7 Bg5+
